title: Marc Guehi seeks advice from John Terry as Chelsea youngster emerges in England Under 21 squad
text:
Marc Guehi picked John Terry’s brains while moving through Chelsea’s academy and is now emerging for England Under 21s.

The central defender, who has three Under 21 caps, made his senior debut during Chelsea’s 7-1 Carabao Cup rout of Grimsby and is eyeing more chances.

Guehi, 19, is expected to start Tuesday’s key European Championship qualifier against Austria in Milton Keynes and has absorbed advice from the best.

19-year-old defender Marc Guehi has made three caps for the England Under 21 side

‘John was a great leader, a great defender and someone I definitely look up to,’ he said. ‘I have spoken with him and he trained with us a few times. He told us to always be focused on what you do, communicating at all times and making sure you’re concentrated.

‘But also that you’re having fun, enjoy what you do. He was underrated when it came to playing out with both feet.’

Blues boss Frank Lampard has put faith in youngsters and Guehi takes inspiration from his peers.

‘Mason Mount, Fikayo Tomori, Tammy Abraham... they’re role models for me,’ he said. ‘They’re young players doing really well and that’s an incentive to know that if you keep working hard, there are opportunities.

The Chelsea youngster made his debut during the 7-1 rout over Grimsby in the Carabao Cup

The defender spoke of the advice he sought from Chelsea legend John Terry as a youngster

England team for Austria qualifier England (4-3-3): Ramsdale; Aarons, Guehi, Panzo, Kelly; Foden, Davies, Willock; Hudson-Odoi, Nketiah, McNeil

‘I just need to keep working hard and if I’m called upon, I need to make sure I’m ready.’ Guehi’s distribution has impressed England after making his Under 21 bow last month and he is becoming an imposing presence at the back.

England are wary of the threat posed by Group 3 leaders Austria. Only pool winners qualify automatically and the visitors sit on nine points, having played a game more.

‘They’re a really tough team,’ Guehi added. ‘They’ve won their games, like us. I’ve no doubt that if we go out there and play the stuff we know, we’ll be fine and get three points.’
